conditions.message: Chest pain with associated symptoms like sweating, nausea, or pain radiating to the left arm may indicate a heart attack. Seek emergency care immediately.
Sudden shortness of breath with chest pain or blue lips can indicate a life-threatening emergency such as a pulmonary embolism. Call emergency services immediately.
A sudden, severe headache with confusion, stiff neck, or loss of consciousness may suggest a brain bleed or meningitis. Seek emergency care immediately.
Severe abdominal pain with fever, persistent vomiting, or blood in the stool could indicate appendicitis or other serious conditions. Get urgent medical evaluation.
A rash with sudden swelling or breathing difficulty may indicate a severe allergic reaction (anaphylaxis). Use an epinephrine auto-injector if available and call emergency services immediately.
Dizziness with sudden weakness, speech problems, or vision changes may be signs of a stroke. Call emergency services immediately.
Fever with stiff neck, confusion, or seizures may indicate meningitis or a severe systemic infection. Seek emergency care immediately.
Severe abdominal pain or heavy bleeding during pregnancy could indicate miscarriage or ectopic pregnancy. Seek emergency care immediately.
Sudden confusion, seizures, or loss of consciousness may indicate a serious neurological or systemic emergency. Call emergency services immediately.
